'''''EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica Ultimate Reference Suite''''' is an [[encyclopÃ¦dia]] published by [[EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica, Inc.]], available on [[DVD]].
==Contents== The DVD contains over 100,000 articles, an [[atlas]], around 35,000 media files ([[images]], [[video]] and [[Audio file format|audio]])<ref>http://www.britannicastore.com/Britannica-2010-Ultimate-Reference-DVD/invt/042110800dm</ref> and a [[dictionary]] and [[thesaurus]] based on [[Merriam-Webster]].
==Linux support== There is no official release of Britannica for the [[Linux|Linux operating system]], however, a script is provided that can help experienced users run ''EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica 2004 Ultimate Reference Suite DVD'' (and other 2004 editions of Britannica) on Linux, with some limitations (for example the dictionary, Flash/Quicktime presentations, and content update functions do not work, and preferences must be edited manually).<ref>http://support.britannica.com/linux/linux.htm</ref> This script specifically requires version 1.3.1 of [[Java (software platform)|JRE]], but can usually be made to work with newer versions if the version check is [[Comment (computer programming)|commented out]].
The 2004 Britannica installer does not run in [[Wine (software)|Wine]] as of 2011.
